text: hi everyone shark thingy tank tano here
the internet's
sleepiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of
this new self-titled spirit possession
album this is the debut full-length lp
of this portland based
metal duo their particular sound grabbed
my attention earlier this year when i
heard a few teasers for this lp
back in may and june spirit possession
plays a brand of black metal that feels
deeply in touch with the genre's roots
and i don't simply mean
the 90s stuff like a dark throne or
a mayhem something like that think more
the inception point of the genre where
the earliest bands
showcased an obvious love for heavy
metal and thrash metal on their
spiked gauntlets so while the seven
tracks on this record do feel like a bit
of a throwback
spirit possession also gets a little
anachronistic with it there are
characteristics
of this album that remind me of the
early work of let's say bathory
but everything on this record from the
vocals to the riffs
in comparison feels way more aggressive
and out of control
the super shrill guitar tone which the
bass does take the edge off of slightly
by
melting into it thumping drums and b
steel lead vocals that are just awash in
this
very loud aggressive delay which
just bulldozes over every other sound
in the mix what spirit possession has
done here is like a
noisier and unintentionally psychedelic
version
of an old-school obscure black metal
demo
if i had to describe it in two words
pure
chaos but some pretty good compositional
ideas do translate through the madness
on nearly every track
whether it be the gnarly and chilling
old-school guitar shredding on the intro
deity of knives and pointed apparitions
the way the head banging metal riffs on
that track also fluidly transition
into throttling blast beat passages also
a lot of the leads on this track
feature these fast fluttering hammer-ons
they are constant not just through this
track but through much of the album
there's also the grim and intense
layered guitar leads on the title track
of the record
which sound like the soundtrack to a
nightmare where i am trapped in a
vampire lair
on acid the preceding rifts from here
are a labyrinth of sorts it is
pure head banging catharsis but always
changing it up very quickly
never settling on one idea for too long
by comparison the structure of twin
tongue pathways is a lot steadier
but it does kick off with this deafening
noise intro that sounds like i'm trapped
in a warehouse
where a crazed killer brings innocent
people to shock them with car batteries
and [ __ ] the guitars do lack a bit of
imagination on this track especially
considering
the insanity of the past two songs but i
gotta say it's kind of made up for by
how
unhinged the vocals are here it is not
often that you hear black metal passages
done in three for a time which we do get
on
amongst inverted castles and holy
laughter the lumbering groove and gnarly
tremolo picking on this track are
fantastic
with only seven tracks ranging from four
to five minutes
it's a pretty no bs album but the
downside of that is there is very little
in terms of versatility on this thing
which is unfortunate because it does
seem like the talent is there
to write some incredible and dynamic
intros
outros builds or bridges for example the
cool little acoustic
interlude on the outro track and the
synths that back that up that's a pretty
interesting moment something i wish
there was a bit more of on the record
space texture atmosphere but instead
of doing that the band kind of opts for
a listening experience that's a lot more
like
being dragged into and out of hell at
top speed
in like 30 minutes or so with no pit
stops
which i think could have been a more
enjoyable or even more intense
experience if it were just a bit more
nuanced
because after a while the uninterrupted
extremity does get a little
numbing it's a testament to the duo's
raw talent that they're still able to
deliver
engaging moments and ideas on each song
like the demented and kind of slow
harmonious breakdown with wailing
tremolo layers on swallowing throne
or what sounds like really speedy 30
second note high hats on the
intro section of the closing track a
groove that you don't often get on a
black metal record but
the duo totally makes it work while i
did walk away from this spirit
possession album wanting a bit more
it's a pretty sick debut with a lot of
thrilling and explosive performances on
it
really a disorienting assault on the
ears and a truly unforgiving american
black metal project
feeling a light seven on this one tran
position have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should i
review next hit the like if you like
please subscribe and please don't cry
hit the bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video that you can check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano spirit possession
forever
